idioms.meaning: (bringing up a child) with greatest care pampering (him, her) with material comforts of a rich family
the importance of creating an environment conducive to a child's learning
something that one would not expect to exist

idioms.reading: ひつようははつめいのはは
idioms.meaning: necessity is the mother of invention

idioms.reading: もうぼだんきのおしえ
idioms.meaning: (the lesson that) one should not leave things unfinished

idioms.reading: しっぱいはせいこうのはは
idioms.meaning: failure is the mother of success

idioms.word: 女は弱しされど母は強し
idioms.reading: おんなはよわしされどはははつよし
idioms.meaning: though the woman is weak, the mother is strong

idioms.word: 庇を貸して母屋を取られる
idioms.reading: ひさしをかしておもやをとられる
idioms.meaning: to have one's kindness taken advantage of

idioms.word: 身体髪膚これを父母に受くあえて毀傷せざるは孝の始めなり
idioms.reading: しんたいはっぷこれをふぼにうくあえてきしょうせざるはこうのはじめなり
idioms.meaning: filial piety begins with not harming one's own body (as one's entire body was given by one's parents)
